org.parboiled
Class MatcherContext<V>

java.lang.Object
  org.parboiled.MatcherContext<V>
Type Parameters:
V - the node value type
All Implemented Interfaces:
Context<V>
public class MatcherContext<V>
extends Object
implements Context<V>

The Context implementation orchestrating most of the matching process.

The parsing process works as following:
After the rule tree (which is in fact a directed and potentially even cyclic graph of Matcher instances) has been created a root MatcherContext is instantiated for the root rule (Matcher). A subsequent call to runMatcher(boolean) starts the parsing process.

The MatcherContext essentially calls Matcher.match(MatcherContext, boolean) passing itself to the Matcher which executes its logic, potentially calling sub matchers. For each sub matcher the matcher calls runMatcher(org.parboiled.matchers.Matcher, boolean) on its Context, which creates a sub context of the current MatcherContext and runs the given sub matcher in it.

This basically creates a stack of MatcherContexts, each corresponding to their rule matchers. The MatcherContext instances serve as a kind of companion objects to the matchers, providing them with support for building the parse tree nodes, keeping track of input locations and error recovery.

At each point during the parsing process the matchers and action methods have access to the current MatcherContext and all "open" parent MatcherContexts through the getParent() chain.

Description copied from interface: Context

Specified by:

getNodeByPath

public Node<V> getNodeByPath(String path)
Description copied from interface: Context

Returns the first node that matches the given path. See ParseTreeUtils.findNodeByPath(org.parboiled.Node, String) )} for a description of the path argument.

Caution: Be aware of the current state of the parse tree when calling this method. You can only reference nodes that have already been created. Since parse tree nodes are immutable they are only created when their complete subtrees are fully determined. This means that all parent nodes have not yet been created when you call this method. Note that you can still access the value objects of future parent nodes through the getParent() chain.

Specified by:
getNodeByPath in interface Context<V>
Parameters:
path - the path to the node being searched for
Returns:
the node if found or null if not found

getNodeByLabel

public Node<V> getNodeByLabel(String labelPrefix)
Description copied from interface: Context

Returns the first node that matches the given labelPrefix.

Caution: Be aware of the current state of the parse tree when calling this method. You can only reference nodes that have already been created. Since parse tree nodes are immutable they are only created when their complete subtrees are fully determined. This means that all parent nodes have not yet been created when you call this method. Note that you can still access the value objects of future parent nodes through the getParent() chain.

Specified by:
getNodeByLabel in interface Context<V>
Parameters:
labelPrefix - the label prefix to search for
Returns:
the node if found or null if not found

getLastNode

public Node<V> getLastNode()
Description copied from interface: Context
Returns the last node created during this parsing run. The last node is independent from the current context scope, i.e. all context along the context chain would return the same object at any given point in the parsing process.

Specified by:
getLastNode in interface Context<V>
Returns:
the last node created during this parsing run.
